item.title: Senate closer to passing immigration bill
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A bill that would toughen border security while giving millions of illegal immigrants a chance to earn U.S. citizenship cleared a test vote in the Senate on Wednesday, setting the stage for passage this week and a bruising battle with the House of Representatives.

item.title: Ex-Bush official hid ties to Abramoff, US says
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A former Bush administration official lied to investigators in an attempt to hide the influence-peddling activities of disgraced lobbyist Jack Abramoff, federal prosecutors said on Wednesday.

item.title: US sees progress, no final agreement on Iran package
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Major powers have made progress on a package of incentives and disincentives aimed at resolving the Iran nuclear crisis but have not reached final agreement and more meetings are likely, State Department spokesman Sean McCormack said on Wednesday.

item.title: Olmert urges action to head off nuclear Iran
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Israeli Prime Minister Ehud Olmert said on Wednesday Iran's nuclear ambitions posed "the test of our time" and urged swift international action to meet what he termed a threat to the existence of the Jewish state.

item.title: Rights group requests wiretapping probe
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - The American Civil Liberties Union launched a 20-state campaign on Wednesday to stop warrantless eavesdropping by the National Security Agency and prevent telecoms firms from providing it with phone records.

item.title: New Orleans seen top US target for '06 hurricanes
item.description: ORLANDO, Florida (Reuters) - New Orleans, still down and out from last year's assault by Hurricane Katrina, is the U.S. city most likely to be struck by hurricane force winds during the 2006 storm season, a researcher said on Wednesday.

item.title: Experts looking for bird flu spread watch for deaths
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A suspicious-looking cluster of human bird flu cases in Indonesia illustrates just how difficult it will be to detect the beginning of a pandemic, should one occur, scientists said on Wednesday.

item.title: Iraq talks up timetable ahead of Bush-Blair talks
item.description: BAGHDAD (Reuters) - The new Iraqi government talked up the prospects of its security forces taking over from U.S.-led troops on the eve of talks between George W. Bush and Tony Blair that could chart the allies' next steps in Iraq.

item.title: Deputy Secretary of State may quit: officials
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Deputy Secretary of State Robert Zoellick is considering leaving his post, U.S. officials said on Wednesday and one said a possible factor was that he was not being promoted to treasury secretary.

item.title: FBI tears down barn in search for Jimmy Hoffa
item.description: DETROIT (Reuters) - FBI contractors tore apart a barn on a Michigan horse farm on Wednesday, looking for the body of Jimmy Hoffa as they pursued a long-neglected lead in the labor leader's 1975 disappearance.
